intro: Manulea sopubia, commonly known as the narrowleaf manulea, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Manulea sopubia is adapted to withstand high temperatures and limited water availability.
